intro: Crepis blattarifolia, commonly known as the bladderleaf mouse-ear, is a flowering plant species belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its small, rosette-forming leaves that are covered in fine hairs, giving them a fuzzy appearance. The plant produces yellow flowers arranged in a single, compact head, typical of the daisy family. It thrives in moist, calcareous soils and is often found in mountainous regions across Europe. Crepis blattarifolia is a perennial herb that plays a role in stabilizing soil in its native habitats.
